title: Kielbasa with Peppers and Potatoes Recipe
description: An easy kielbasa recipe combines this smokey sausage with red and yellow bell peppers and potatoes. A simple, satisfying dish that everyone will love.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Everyday Cooking Kielbasa with Peppers and Potatoes 4.5 (800) 617 Reviews 105 Photos An easy kielbasa recipe cooked with red and yellow peppers and potatoes. Submitted by Jeff Maloney Updated on July 14, 2022 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 105 105 105 105 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 1 (16 ounce) package smoked kielbasa sausage, diced 6 medium red potatoes, diced 1 red bell pepper, sliced 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced Directions Gather the ingredients. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Place kielbasa and potatoes in the pan. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender, about 25 minutes. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS Mix bell peppers into the pan, and continue cooking until peppers are just tender, 5 minutes. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS Serve and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS I Made It Print 1,194 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 404 Calories 23g Fat 36g Carbs 13g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 404 % Daily Value * Total Fat 23g 30% Saturated Fat 7g 37% Cholesterol 50mg 17% Sodium 697mg 30% Total Carbohydrate 36g 13% Dietary Fiber 4g 13% Total Sugars 3g Protein 13g 27% Vitamin C 22mg 24% Calcium 34mg 3% Iron 2mg 12% Potassium 1201mg 26% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Kielbasa with Peppers and Potatoes 01 of 105 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS 02 of 105 Photo by  Cameron Mathies 04/25/2025 If you start cooking the kielbasa right off you end up with charred bits of inedible food. Wait 20 minutes after starting potatoes to add the kielbasa. 03 of 105 Photo by  atbarber 06/12/2024 OK with tweaks I read other reviews before making this so I did incorporate some changes. I started cooking the cubed potatoes in a little butter and olive oil. I seasoned them with salt, pepper and paprika and covered the pan. After the potatoes started to brown and soften, I added some chopped garlic scapes, onion, bell peppers, zucchini and sliced, smoked organic sausage. I pan sauteed the mixture until the sausage was slightly browned and the vegetables were tender. Some dried parsley was sprinkled on top to finish the dish! It came together quickly and was very tasty! 04 of 105 Photo by  DREGINEK 05/29/2024 Over the years, I have done so many variations of sausage and potatoes on the stovetop with varying degrees of success. I have learned by now, for me and using my cookware/stovetop - I get the best results when the potatoes are parboiled. You don’t want them fully cooked but a heads start on them will work wonders. I parboiled the potatoes the night before so when I started this recipe, I followed in order as stated; I just didn’t need to cover the pan. I added a chopped onion and some shredded carrots leftover from another recipe. Simple yet hearty and good. The potatoes could use some seasoning - perhaps some all season salt - but not much because the sausage and onions/peppers add the flavors for you! Thanks Jeff! 05 of 105 Photo by  montgcn 05/25/2022 I have been making this for years but with a few modifications. I add a sweet onion cut into half inch wedges, half of a red onion cut into half inch wedges, a green bell pepper, salt, pepper , garlic powder and olive oil. I toss everything with olive oil and the seasoning (to taste) and roast in the oven until vegetables are done. I’ve used red potatoes, gold Yukon potatoes and russets (russets take a bit longer to cook) and a mixture of all 3. This recipe is very versatile! It’s one of my fiancé’s favorite dinners. 06 of 105 Photo by  ak_sourdough 01/21/2022 Fast, yummy and easy to make. I substituted the potatoes for pierogies and added onions. 07 of 105 Photo by  Tina Poer 09/29/2021 I have made per recipe many times and only added seasonings and a little bit of water to create steam. I've also added brussel sprouts several times. I blanch them first. Thanks for a great foundation recipe. 08 of 105 Photo by  Tina Poer 09/29/2021 I have made per recipe many times and only added seasonings and a little bit of water to create steam. I've also added brussel sprouts several times. I blanch them first. Thanks for a great foundation recipe. 09 of 105 Photo by  Tina Poer 09/29/2021 I have made per recipe many times and only added seasonings and a little bit of water to create steam. I've also added brussel sprouts several times. I blanch them first. Thanks for a great foundation recipe. 10 of 105 Photo by  lazoris 09/16/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Italian Sausage, Peppers, and Onions 1,896 Ratings Stuffed Peppers with Turkey and Vegetables 662 Ratings Portobello Mushroom Caps and Veggies 58 Ratings Tomato Basil Salmon 315 Ratings Grilled Lemon-Pepper Zucchini 52 Ratings Egg in a Pepper 94 Ratings Grilled Italian Sausage 2 Ratings Farmer's Market Vegetarian Quesadillas 516 Ratings Bow Tie Pasta with Sausage and Sweet Peppers 399 Ratings Green Tomato and Bell Pepper Delight 21 Ratings Tempeh Fajitas 56 Ratings Ajiaco (Beef and Pepper Stew) 23 Ratings Sauteed Chicken and Red Peppers Mango Salsa 491 Ratings Tofu and Veggies in Peanut Sauce 417 Ratings Vikki's Red Bean Sausage 139 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Jeff Maloney
instructions: Gather the ingredients. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS;Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Place kielbasa and potatoes in the pan. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender, about 25 minutes. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS;Mix bell peppers into the pan, and continue cooking until peppers are just tender, 5 minutes. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS;Serve and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
